taskDescription:
Fill all the gaps in blue by clicking-and-holding a concept in a grey box and draging it into its corresponding definition. Beware that not all concepts have a matching definition!

 

When done, (scroll down to) click the “Check” button.

 

Tip: Instead of drag-and-drop, you can also click on a concept and then click on the gap where you want to place it.
resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?
a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.
a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
textField:
*Online*: In the context of this training, it refers to an examination that takes place using an internet-based platform. 

*Question (Textbox)*: Where the contents (e.g. text, images, links, code snippets, LaTeX) of the question will be added.

*Quizzes*: The name of the page in CLMS where an e-exam can be created.

*Automatic Evaluation*: It refers to question types such as Multiple Choice, Multiple Answer, Matching, Kprime, and Ordering where the grade for each submitted answer is automatically determined by the platform based on criteria pre-determined by the question creator.

*Semi-Automatic Evaluation*: Question types such as Short Answer where the platform provides a preliminary grade of a submitted answer but the instructor still is required to review the submitted answer in order to assign a final grade for the question.

*Manual Evaluation*: Question type such as Free Format Response that require the instructor to review and provide a grade to each submitted answer.
